title: Meh
text: I wish there was a way to ping the sensors.

title: Good devices, easy setup, bad app
text: With a more sophisticated app, this could be a really good product, but the app seems like it’s still in development. For example, there’s very few options for customizing the garage door sensor notifications.  You get notified every time the garage door opens and closes. The notification is the same as a text message. Eventually I disabled all notifications from the door. It should be easier to see whether the garage door is open or closed on the home screen rather than having to click down. On the other hand, the devices are cheap and easy to set up. This rest is the easy part to fix!  Hoping for an update to the app soon

title: An app designed by an engineer
text: This app seems to have been designed by an engineer working in this product, or otherwise by someone who does not pay attention to Ui design, user-friendliness, collection of focus-group feedback or A/B testing - or pretty much any type of work which is required for a main-stream application. It is hard to configure the application for in-home use without guessing whether a ‘logical-and’ or a ‘logical-or’ is intended, something which should not have been necessary for a consumer-facing app. Overall a disappointment for a hardware product that could have been great.

title: Can’t even make an account
text: They won’t let you make an account unless you verify via SMS. Their verification service API doesn’t seem to work with T-Mobile so their solution is to have you spend several hours on the phone with your cellular provider asking them to enable text verifications rather then providing you another way to create an account. Unfortunate, as I was looking forward to piloting these through my insurance company, but now I have to call my insurance company and send them back because you can’t even get past the first step.

title: Roost alerted me to a dishwasher leak
text: Roost alerted me to a leak in my kitchen when I was at work. When I returned home shortly after, I saw that the dishwasher had leaked out all over my kitchen floor. Because I received the notification, I was aware that something was wrong before I got home and was able to schedule a handyman to come out the very next morning.

title: Bad user interface
text:
This is a nice concept, but the interface wasn’t designed well.  For example, it currently tells me “! Your devices need attention”.  My “Dishwasher” device says “! Reported on Jan 9 at 3:02 am”. That’s it, there’s no way to find out what was reported or to reset it.  There’s a graph of temperature and humidity, but they’re in range.

I finally threw them away. After many many false positives I had a real leak from a dripping sink. I dried the sensor off and after > 12 hours it was still beeping.

title: Needs HomeKit compatibility
text: Although the app appears to have secure encryption it does require a WiFi password to be manually entered rather than connecting to WiFi through HomeKit. This would be an outstanding device if it connected through and worked through Apple HomeKit.

title: Humidity alerts
text: The Roost leak detector under my kitchen sink was sending me high humidity alerts. I kept ignoring the alerts since there was no water. Finally checked it out and discovered water under my house in the crawl space from a cracked pipe. Thank you Roost!

title: App crashes and difficult to install devices
text: This app and compatible products has a long ways to go! Received the device for free from USAA insurance company. The product certainly seems to have value for home protection, but set up and app functionality are poor. When the app and devices become compatible with Apple and the iPhone, I will increase the number of stars.

title: Products don’t work, they won’t warranty.
text: Bought the batteries and they wouldn’t connect. Day 1 support I was told the warranty was void. They say you have to buy at an “authorized retailer” but they don’t list who those are. Also the warranty card doesn’t say anything about who you have to purchase from. Don’t buy anything from this garbage company with no support. Their customer service is the worst.

title: Saved us!
text: Easy to use and information is great.  Already saved us a potential water loss by alerting us to a washer leak situation!!

title: Extremely difficult to use
text: We have a Roost battery in our kitchen’s smoke alarm. Cooking occasionally sets off or kitchen smoke alarm, so we got a Roost battery for it so we could easily turn it off when this happens. You’d think Roost would make this way to do, but NOPE! Incredibly unintuitive app

title: A disappointment all around
text: Got a free water leak detector from my insurance company. Spent over an hour trying to setup/connect the device to the app with no success. Even read and watched all setup videos and trouble shooting. Even for free this thing is a disappoinment, wasted time for something that you can't ever setup.

title: App has gotten worse
text: Bought smoke detector battery to be able to silence nuisance alarms for a very high smoke detector. Worked  fine several years ago.  Now that Roost has multiple products, the battery controls are gone.

title: Disconnected
text: Good idea for a water leak detector but mine disconnects all the time and I have to go fish it out of the spot I want it in the basement and reset it. Would probably be easier to get a Flood Buzz and only have to change it every 5 years or so.

title: What happened
text:
Another clean elegant app ruined by feature bloat and poor customer focus. 
It still works but is now to complex to view information quickly....

Roll it back a few versions and it will be fine.

title: Good updates
text: Thanks for the continued updates! App is stable with reliable alerting. I’d love to export data and have more visualization options.

title: Doesn’t work at all
text:

Pretty much a totally useless product

title: Horrible device and service
text: This device was impossible to connect to my Wi-Fi, so I called roost and each time I called the voicemail said no one is available to take your call. Horrible!                   Andrew

title: This makes no sense
text: I get an alert that but when I go to the app, it doesn’t that tell me anything other than just show me an icon with no details. The push notification has more detail.

title: Frustrating

title: Nice refresh on UI
text: New app UI really nice. Also love the silent setup with the new leak detectors! Great job Roost!

title: Piece of crap

title: So far so good
text:
Battery was a pretty tight fit inside the smoke detector. It almost didn’t fit.  Be aware of a very loud setup process.  I had my dog next to me during setup when it suddenly started blasting sound from my phone.  Totally freaked out my dogs.  The app needs a sound warning. 

I thought I was deleting an alert from the phone, instead I deleted the entire battery from the setup and had to do the setup again. 

I haven’t setup my 2nd battery yet.

title: Just made 6 Smoke Detectors Smart
text:
I purchased 7 units while Roost was using Kickstarter.  Each Smart Battery arrived few days ago.  I was able to pair each battery using the App. Out of 6 Roost units I paired only 2 of them I had to pair multiple times.  This is potentially related to wifi interference or server issues on Roost end, hard to tell. Trying 2nd or 3rd time worked.

Each Roost can be labeled with the location and address can be specified.  Kids wish there was an option to separate the units by address.  In case I had more than 1 house, but also to easily select address from the list to updated each Roost quickly.  Current setup requires user to type in the address for each battery.

Now time will tell how quickly alert appears after smoke detector makes noise.  From current test I performed on each battery alert was almost immediate except for initial battery which had a 2 min delay.  Could have been a glitch or just initial setup issues.

title: Just installed the battery
text: That was way easier to set up with a nice simply setup procedure requiring minimal information to get working.  I was a little surprised by the old fashion modem initiate connection sound during the iPhone to battery linkup.  Everything works and now I'm wondering how long this stays working.

title: Piece of junk
text: The battery doesn't work as expected. Keeps beeping and annoying you instead of working without being noticed. The app is very primitive and does help much. Back to the good old battery.

title: Smoother interface
text: The new version of the app (3.0) is very nice. Seems more efficient. I like that I can have multiple locations with their devices grouped. Can't wait to get their water leak detectors for my basement.

title: Works great!
text: This app is great and makes the physical products easy to use.

title: Not impressed
text: App has limited capability.  Battery causes chirps instead of eliminating them.
